Circumstance Adverbials.description: Provide information about the situation of the clause (traditional 'adverbials of time, place, manner, etc.').

Time.description: Indicate when the action or event takes place.

Place.description: Indicate the location of the action or event.

Manner/Means.description: Describe how the action is performed or the means by which it occurs.

Degree/Extent.description: Express the intensity, extent, or completeness of the action.

Frequency.description: Express how often the action occurs.

Duration.description: Express how long the action lasts.

Stance Adverbials.description: Express the speaker's or writer's perspective, evaluation, or attitude toward the proposition.

Epistemic Stance.description: Express the speaker’s level of certainty, doubt, or probability of the proposition.

Attitudinal Stance.description: Express the speaker’s emotional reaction or evaluation of the proposition.

Style Stance (Comment).description: Comment on the manner of speaking, truthfulness, or rhetorical framing.

Linking Adverbials.description: Connect the current clause to prior discourse, showing logical or rhetorical relationships.

Result/Consequence.description: Indicate an outcome or result of what was stated before.

Contrast/Concession.description: Express opposition, concession, or contrast between clauses.

Addition.description: Add information in relation to the prior clause.

Enumeration/Summation.description: Organize discourse by listing or summarizing points.

Transition.description: Mark a shift in topic or provide a digression.

Discourse Organizing Adverbials.description: Manage the flow of discourse, mark topic changes, or frame interaction.
